com.nnvmso.web
Class PlayerAPIController

java.lang.Object
  com.nnvmso.web.PlayerAPIController

@Controller
@RequestMapping(value="playerAPI")
public class PlayerAPIController
extends java.lang.Object

Serves for Player.

Url examples: (notice method name is used at the end of URL)
http://hostname:port/playerAPI/channelBrowse
http://hostname:port/podcastAPI/login

login

@RequestMapping(value="login",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
User login.

Only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
email - email
password - password
Returns:
A string of a return code and a return message, tab delimited.
If signup succeeds, the return message will be the user key, otherwise it returns error message.
Example: "0 aghubmUydm1zb3IMCxIGTm5Vc2VyGDkM", "100 Login Failed".

signup

@RequestMapping(value="signup",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> signup(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
User signup.

only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
email - email
password - password
name - display name
Returns:
A string of a return code and a return message, tab delimited.
If signup succeeds, the return message will be the user key, otherwise it returns error message.
Example: "0 aghubmUydm1zb3IMCxIGTm5Vc2VyGDkM", "200 Missing Params".

guestRegister

@RequestMapping(value="guestRegister")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> guestRegister(@RequestParam(value="ipg",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String ipg,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Register a guest account. If ipg is provided, guest is automatically subscribed to all the channels in the ipg.

Parameters:
ipg - ipg identifier, it is optional
Returns:
A string of return code and a user key, tab delimited. Failed operation will return return code and error message.
Example: "0 aghubmUydm1zb3IMCxIGTm5Vc2VyGDkM", "3 Fatal Error".

userTokenVerify

@RequestMapping(value="userTokenVerify")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> userTokenVerify(@RequestParam(value="token")
                                                                                                java.lang.String token,
                                                                                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
Verify a user token
Example: http://localhost/playerAPI/userTokenVerify?token=aghubmUzdm1zb3INCxIGTm5Vc2VyGKsEDA

Parameters:
token - user key
Returns:
return code and return message, tab delimited.
Will delete the user cookie if token is invalid.
Example: "0 Success", "4 Invalid user token".

please refer to channelLineup()

channelBrowse

@RequestMapping(value="channelBrowse")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelBrowse()
Browse all the on-air channels.

Returns:
A string of all the channels' information.
Each channel is \n delimited. Each channel's information is tab delimited.
Channel info has channel id, channel name, channel image url.
Example: 1 Channel1 http://hostname/images/img.jpg

whatsNew

@RequestMapping(value="whatsNew")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> whatsNew(@RequestParam(value="user")
                                                                                         java.lang.String user)
Get "new" program list. Current "new" definition: A channel's latest 3 shows.

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
Returns:
A string of new program list.
Each program is \n delimited.
Example: 1\n2\n3\n

channelLineup

@RequestMapping(value="channelLineup")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelLineup(@RequestParam(value="user")
                                                                                              java.lang.String user)
Get all of a user's subscriptions.

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
Returns:

A string of all of the user's subscribed channels' information.

Each channel is \n delimited. Each channel's information is tab delimited.

Channel info has following fields:

grid id, channel id,
channel name, channel description, channel image url,
program count, type(SYSTEM|PODCAST), status

Example: 1 1 Channel1 http://hostname/images/img.jpg 3 SYSTEM 0

nnScript

@RequestMapping(value="nnscript")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> nnScript(@RequestParam(value="program")
                                                                                         long programId)
Get program script based on program id.

Example: http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/nnscript?program=566

Parameters:
program - program id
Returns:
9x9script

programInfo

@RequestMapping(value="programInfo")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> programInfo(@RequestParam(value="channel")
                                                                                            java.lang.String channel,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String user,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="ipg",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.Long ipgId,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Get program information based on query criteria.

Examples:
http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=*&user=aghubmUzdm1zb3INCxIGTm5Vc2VyGKsEDA
http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=*&ipg=13671109
http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=153,158
http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=153

Parameters:
channel - (1)Could be *, all the programs, e.g. channel=* (user is required for wildcard query). (2)Could be a channel Id, e.g. channel=1
(3)Could be list of channels, e.g. channels = 34,35,36.
user - user's unique identifier, it is required for wildcard query
ipg - ipg's unique identifier, it is required for wildcard query
Returns:

A string of all the programs' info that met the query criteria.

Each program is separate by carriage return. Each program's information is tab delimited.

Program info has:
channelId, programId, programName, description(max length=256),
programType, duration,
programThumbnailUrl, programLargeThumbnailUrl,
url1(mpeg4/slideshow), url2(webm), url3(flv more likely), url4(audio),
timestamp

podcastSubmit

@RequestMapping(value="podcastSubmit",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> podcastSubmit(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Generate a channel based on a podcast RSS feed.

Only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
podcastRSS - a podcast RSS feed
user - user's unique identifier
grid - grid location //overwrite!!!!
Returns:
A string of return code and channel id, tab delimited.
!!!!!!!! Failed operation will return return code and error message.

subscribe

@RequestMapping(value="subscribe")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> subscribe(@RequestParam(value="user")
                                                                                          java.lang.String user,
                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="channel")
                                                                                          long channel,
                                                                                          @RequestParam(value="grid")
                                                                                          short grid)
User subscribes a channel on a designated grid location.

Example: http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/subscribe?user=aghubmUydm1zb3IMCxIGTm5Vc2VyGDkM&channel=51&grid=2

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
channel - channelId
grid - grid location, from 1 to 81
Returns:
A string of return code and return message, tab delimited.

@RequestMapping(value="unsubscribe")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> unsubscribe(@RequestParam(value="user")
                                                                                            java.lang.String user,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="channel")
                                                                                            long channel)
User unsubscribes a channel

Example: http://localhost:8888/playerAPI/unsubscribe?user=aghubmUydm1zb3IMCxIGTm5Vc2VyGDkM&channel=51

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
channel - channelId
Returns:
A string of return code and return message, tab delimited.

curatorInfo

public java.lang.String curatorInfo(@RequestParam(value="curator")
                                                 java.lang.String curator,
                                                 @RequestParam(value="delimited",required=false)
                                                 java.lang.String delimited)
NOT IN USE: Get curator information

Parameters:
curator - curator key
Returns:
curator info Fields are tab delimited. Fields sequence: msoName, msoIntro, msoThumbnailUrl
